alert.note: Alert for Clinton; Jackson (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 04 at 3:45PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Jo Daviess, Carroll, Stephenson, southeastern Jackson and northeastern Clinton Counties through 445 PM CDT... At 344 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Hanover to near Argo Fay. Movement was northeast at 60 mph. HAZARD...Half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Elizabeth around 350 PM CDT. Mount Carroll, Woodbine and Schapville around 355 PM CDT. Apple River around 400 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Lanark, Warren, Nora, Pearl City, Shannon, Winslow, Freeport, Cedarville, Dakota and Ridott. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
